ACCEL.comment: Defines an accelerator key used in an accelerator table.

ACL.comment: The ACL structure is the header of an access control list (ACL). A complete ACL consists of an ACL structure followed by an ordered list of zero or more access control entries (ACEs).

ACTCTX.comment: The ACTCTX structure is used by the CreateActCtx function to create the activation context.

BIND_OPTS.comment: Contains parameters used during a moniker-binding operation.

BITMAP.comment: The BITMAP structure defines the type, width, height, color format, and bit values of a bitmap.

BITMAPFILEHEADER.comment: The BITMAPFILEHEADER structure contains information about the type, size, and layout of a file that contains a DIB.

BITMAPINFO.comment: The BITMAPINFO structure defines the dimensions and color information for a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

BITMAPINFOHEADER.comment: The BITMAPINFOHEADER structure contains information about the dimensions and color format of a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

BLUETOOTH_DEVICE_SEARCH_PARAMS.comment: The BLUETOOTH_DEVICE_SEARCH_PARAMS structure specifies search criteria for Bluetooth device searches.

BLUETOOTH_FIND_RADIO_PARAMS.comment: The BLUETOOTH_FIND_RADIO_PARAMS structure facilitates enumerating installed Bluetooth radios.

BLUETOOTH_OOB_DATA_INFO.comment: The BLUETOOTH_OOB_DATA_INFO structure contains data used to authenticate prior to establishing an Out-of-Band device pairing.

CHOOSECOLOR.comment: Contains information the ChooseColor function uses to initialize the Color dialog box. After the user closes the dialog box, the system returns information about the user's selection in this structure.

CHOOSEFONT.comment: Contains information that the ChooseFont function uses to initialize the Font dialog box. After the user closes the dialog box, the system returns information about the user's selection in this structure.

COLORADJUSTMENT.comment: The COLORADJUSTMENT structure defines the color adjustment values used by the StretchBlt and StretchDIBits functions when the stretch mode is HALFTONE. You can set the color adjustment values by calling the SetColorAdjustment function.

CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO.comment: Contains information about the console cursor.

CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO.comment: Contains information about a console screen buffer.

CONSOLE_SELECTION_INFO.comment: Contains information for a console selection.

COORD.comment: Defines the coordinates of a character cell in a console screen buffer. The origin of the coordinate system (0,0) is at the top, left cell of the buffer.

CREATESTRUCT.comment: Defines the initialization parameters passed to the window procedure of an application. These members are identical to the parameters of the CreateWindowEx function.

CREDENTIAL.comment: The CREDENTIAL structure contains an individual credential.

CREDENTIAL_ATTRIBUTE.comment: The CREDENTIAL_ATTRIBUTE structure contains an application-defined attribute of the credential. An attribute is a keyword-value pair. It is up to the application to define the meaning of the attribute.

DESIGNVECTOR.comment: The DESIGNVECTOR structure is used by an application to specify values for the axes of a multiple master font.

DIBSECTION.comment: The DIBSECTION structure contains information about a DIB created by calling the CreateDIBSection function. A DIBSECTION structure includes information about the bitmap's dimensions, color format, color masks, optional file mapping object, and optional bit values storage offset. An application can obtain a filled-in DIBSECTION structure for a given DIB by calling the GetObject function.

DISPPARAMS.comment: Contains the arguments passed to a method or property.

DLGITEMTEMPLATE.comment: Defines the dimensions and style of a control in a dialog box. One or more of these structures are combined with a DLGTEMPLATE structure to form a standard template for a dialog box.

DLGTEMPLATE.comment: Defines the dimensions and style of a dialog box. This structure, always the first in a standard template for a dialog box, also specifies the number of controls in the dialog box and therefore specifies the number of subsequent DLGITEMTEMPLATE structures in the template.

DLLVERSIONINFO.comment: Receives DLL-specific version information. It is used with the DllGetVersion function.

DRAWTEXTPARAMS.comment: The DRAWTEXTPARAMS structure contains extended formatting options for the DrawTextEx function.

EXCEPINFO.comment: Describes an exception that occurred during IDispatch::Invoke.

FILETIME.comment: Contains a 64-bit value representing the number of 100-nanosecond intervals since January 1, 1601 (UTC).

FINDREPLACE.comment: Contains information that the FindText and ReplaceText functions use to initialize the Find and Replace dialog boxes. The FINDMSGSTRING registered message uses this structure to pass the user's search or replacement input to the owner window of a Find or Replace dialog box.

INITCOMMONCONTROLSEX.comment: Carries information used to load common control classes from the dynamic-link library (DLL). This structure is used with the InitCommonControlsEx function.

ITEMIDLIST.comment: Contains a list of item identifiers.

KNOWNFOLDER_DEFINITION.comment: Defines the specifics of a known folder.

LASTINPUTINFO.comment: Contains the time of the last input.

LOGBRUSH.comment: The LOGBRUSH structure defines the style, color, and pattern of a physical brush. It is used by the CreateBrushIndirect and ExtCreatePen functions.

LOGPALETTE.comment: The LOGPALETTE structure defines a logical palette.

MCI_OPEN_PARMS.comment: The MCI_OPEN_PARMS structure contains information for the MCI_OPEN command.

MCI_PLAY_PARMS.comment: The MCI_PLAY_PARMS structure contains positioning information for the MCI_PLAY command.

MCI_SEEK_PARMS.comment: The MCI_SEEK_PARMS structure contains positioning information for the MCI_SEEK command.

MCI_STATUS_PARMS.comment: The MCI_STATUS_PARMS structure contains information for the MCI_STATUS command.

MENUITEMINFO.comment: Contains information about a menu item.

METAFILEPICT.comment: Defines the metafile picture format used for exchanging metafile data through the clipboard.

MINMAXINFO.comment: Contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

MONITORINFO.comment: The MONITORINFO structure contains information about a display monitor.

MOUSEMOVEPOINT.comment: Contains information about the mouse's location in screen coordinates.

MSG.comment: Contains message information from a thread's message queue.

NEWTEXTMETRIC.comment: The NEWTEXTMETRIC structure contains data that describes a physical font.

OPENFILENAME.comment: Contains information that the GetOpenFileName and GetSaveFileName functions use to initialize an Open or Save As dialog box. After the user closes the dialog box, the system returns information about the user's selection in this structure.

PALETTEENTRY.comment: The PALETTEENTRY structure specifies the color and usage of an entry in a logical palette. A logical palette is defined by a LOGPALETTE structure.

POINT.comment: The POINT structure defines the x- and y-coordinates of a point.

POLYTEXT.comment: The POLYTEXT structure describes how the PolyTextOut function should draw a string of text.

POWERBROADCAST_SETTING.comment: Sent with a power setting event and contains data about the specific change.

PROCESS_INFORMATION.comment: Contains information about a newly created process and its primary thread. It is used with the CreateProcess, CreateProcessAsUser, CreateProcessWithLogonW, or CreateProcessWithTokenW function.

PROPERTYKEY.comment: Specifies the FMTID/PID identifier that programmatically identifies a property.

RECT.comment: The RECT structure defines a rectangle by the coordinates of its upper-left and lower-right corners.

RGBQUAD.comment: The RGBQUAD structure describes a color consisting of relative intensities of red, green, and blue.

SAFEARRAYBOUND.comment: Represents the bounds of one dimension of the array.

SCROLLINFO.comment: The SCROLLINFO structure contains scroll bar parameters to be set by the SetScrollInfo function (or SBM_SETSCROLLINFO message), or retrieved by the GetScrollInfo function (or SBM_GETSCROLLINFO message)

SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES.comment:
The SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure contains the security descriptor for an object and specifies whether the handle retrieved by specifying this structure is inheritable.

This structure provides security settings for objects created by various functions, such as CreateFile, CreatePipe, CreateProcess, RegCreateKeyEx, or RegSaveKeyEx.

SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR.comment: The SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR structure contains the security information associated with an object. Applications use this structure to set and query an object's security status.

SHQUERYRBINFO.comment: Contains the size and item count information retrieved by the SHQueryRecycleBin function.

SIZE.comment: The SIZE structure defines the width and height of a rectangle.

SMALL_RECT.comment: Defines the coordinates of the upper left and lower right corners of a rectangle.

SOLE_AUTHENTICATION_SERVICE.comment: Identifies an authentication service that a server is willing to use to communicate to a client.

STARTUPINFO.comment: Specifies the window station, desktop, standard handles, and appearance of the main window for a process at creation time.

STATSTG.comment: The STATSTG structure contains statistical data about an open storage, stream, or byte-array object. This structure is used in the IEnumSTATSTG, ILockBytes, IStorage, and IStream interfaces.

SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.comment: Contains information about the current state of the system battery.

SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS.comment: Contains information about the power status of the system.

SYSTEMTIME.comment: Specifies a date and time, using individual members for the month, day, year, weekday, hour, minute, second, and millisecond. The time is either in coordinated universal time (UTC) or local time, depending on the function that is being called.

TASKDIALOG_BUTTON.comment: The TASKDIALOG_BUTTON structure contains information used to display a button in a task dialog. The TASKDIALOGCONFIG structure uses this structure.

TEXTMETRIC.comment: The TEXTMETRIC structure contains basic information about a physical font. All sizes are specified in logical units; that is, they depend on the current mapping mode of the display context.

TPMPARAMS.comment: Contains extended parameters for the TrackPopupMenuEx function.

VALENT.comment: Contains information about a registry value. The RegQueryMultipleValues function uses this structure.

VS_FIXEDFILEINFO.comment: Contains version information for a file. This information is language and code page independent.

WAVEFORMATEX.comment: The WAVEFORMATEX structure defines the format of waveform-audio data. Only format information common to all waveform-audio data formats is included in this structure. For formats that require additional information, this structure is included as the first member in another structure, along with the additional information.

WAVEHDR.comment: The WAVEHDR structure defines the header used to identify a waveform-audio buffer.

WNDCLASS.comment: Contains the window class attributes that are registered by the RegisterClass function.

XFORM.comment: The XFORM structure specifies a world-space to page-space transformation.
